results.title: Young man with a horn
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Jerry Wald and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Kirk Douglas plays the talented trumpeter, Rick Martin, loosely based on the life of jazz great, Bix Beiderbecke. Rick is a poor white orphan who learns the power of jazz through scouting the black neighbourhoods of his city. He comes in contact with a trumpet player (the brilliant jazz trumpeter Hoagy Carmichael) who teaches him how to play. His genius for the trumpet leads Rick to gigs with all-white orchestras and combos but he aches to play the sensual jazz music he adores. His battle between the demands for material success and his love for music leads him to alcoholism and a life on the streets. Co-starring Lauren Bacall as the rich society woman who Rick marries and who betrays him and Doris Day as the one woman who really understands his love for jazz. “Young Man With a Horn” features some fantastic black and white camerawork on New York locations and a great jazz and popular music score, including the songs “With A Song in My Heart”, “Get Happy” and “Love for Sale”. Based on the novel by Dorothy Baker.

results.title: Young Hands
results.creator_credit: John Martin-Jones, John Appleton and W.H. Shepard
results.brief_description:
Essentially an adverisement for the Juniour Farmer’s Organisation, focusing on how members and the community benefit from it. Stars ‘Hal’, a young man who must continue to run his family’s farm while his father is ill.

Follows Hal and other junior farmers members as they complete various ‘projects’ such as raising lambs, preserving fruit and growing crops. Strong social element within the organisation is exemplified by a social dance that is used to bookend Hal’s story.

Very earnest piece. Amusing end scene.

results.title: Young hands
results.creator_credit: W. H. Shepherd, John Martin-Jones, Australian National Film Board and Dept of the Interior
results.brief_description: Depicts the activities of Young Farmers Clubs in Australia. Two students from Pakistan and Indonesia, visit the club meeting, learn the aims of the club and see how the group functions.

results.title: Young Frankenstein (Special edition)
results.creator_credit: Mel Brooks, Michael Greskoff, Crossbow, Venture and Greskoff
results.brief_description: Mel Brooks takes Mary Shelley’s classic horror story and adds elements of Yiddish theatre, burlesque and camp to create an hilarious send-up of the horror movie genre. Featuring an array of star comic performances (including Cloris Leachman, Marty Feldman, Kenneth Mars), “Young Frankenstein” is considered by some to be director Mel Brooks’ best film. Gene Wilder stars as the grandson of the original Dr. Frankenstein who travels back to an absurd Transylvania to uncover his grandfather’s hideous secrets.

results.title: Young Einstein (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Yahoo Serious, David Roach, Warwick Ross and Serious Productions
results.brief_description: A comedy based on the premise that Albert Einstein not only developed the theory of relativity but also invented rock ‘n roll. Albert Einstein sails the world, falls in love with the world’s most intelligent and beautiful girl, Marie Curie, creates the first surfboard, invents the electric guitar and uses rock ‘n roll to save the planet from atomic destruction. Virtually a one-man tour de force by Yahoo Serious and co-starring Odile le Clezio.

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.title: Vietnam: The Ten Thousand Day War. - Volume 1.
results.creator_credit: Don North, Paul Lang, Ron Kelly, Ian Macleod, Cinequity Funding and Information Television Productions
results.brief_description: Known as history’s first ‘living room war’, the Vietnam conflict is presented here with clarity, authority and insight. Written by Pulitzer Prize winner, Peter Arnett, and narrated by Richard Basehart, it’s seen through the eyes of key policymakers and fighting soldiers. The interviews, film clips, and commentary put this ‘police action’ into an illuminating perspective. “America in Vietnam” - gives an overall perspective of the shifting attitudes of the United States towards Vietnam, from the early liaison to the ultimate fall of Saigon. “Dien Bien Phu” - examines the French surrender at this crucial battle, and how it triggered 20 years of direct American involvement in Vietnam.

results.title: Vietnam: the long road home
results.creator_credit: Peter Corbett, Portland Arts Advisory Board, Film Victoria and Powerhouse
results.brief_description: This film, produced by a Vietnam war veteran, tells the story of ordinary Australians in the Vietnam war mainly from the point of view of conscripts, Channel 9 camera man Reg Boulter, a doctor, Michael Martin and two former political antagonists, Malcolm Fraser and Jim Cairns.

results.title: Vietnam, Australia's war
results.creator_credit: Michael Phillips, Joseph Matthews and Number One
results.brief_description: Examines Australia’s involvement in the Vietnam Conflict, 1962-72 using archival footage, stills, maps, home movies and newspaper headlines. Presents a chronological sequence of events during this period and queries Australia’s involvement. Addresses the long-term health and emotional effects of the conflict on veterans and their families.

results.title: Vietnam requiem
results.creator_credit: Jonas McCord, Bill Couturie and Else, Couturie and Korty
results.brief_description: Five men, each decorated for valor in Vietnam, are interviewed from prison where they are now serving time for crimes committed since their return from the war. Focuses particularly on Albert Dobbs, showing family photos and newsreel footage, and presenting his recollections as well as those of his family and a fellow soldier. Expresses the self-destructive forces set in motion by the horror of war and disillusioning homecomings. Narrated by Peter Thomas.
